page.title: 15Education in Wootton
page.content: In 1959,the Bishop of Oxford opened Wootton C of E School, on the site of another school on farmland.65 children and two full-time teachers go to the school. The school relies on voluntary help from parents, following{education {cuts }which have also affected the range of activities like computing, woodwork and crafts. 44 children have school meals and, according to the cook who has provided these meals for 32 years, they still like the same meals today as they did then. The children enjoy practical tasks like building a pond and producing vegetables and flowers in their school garden. Most of the children go on to schools in Abingdon and as no school bus is provided the local authority plans to establish a{cycle track}along the B417.
